column4: Hi guys, still have not been able to install ubuntu.  It drops me to a busybox.  Can anyone help?
you may have a bad copy
I have tried burning the ISO three times.  Also tried safe graphics and the bugfix pci=nomsi and I can't get the installer to load.
the correct way to put the name is how I just did with you ... type the first few letters of the name then push TAB
Thanks, I got it now :)
wow ... WoW is HUGE!!!
.gnome2 takes up 10GB
not on my machine ... look deeper into that folder and see what it is that is taking up that much space
am  confused about your .gnome2 directory ... I'd like to know what in that dir is taking up so much space
When I right click on the home dir, it shows 6,547 items totaling 11.9GB
dig down .. to .gnome2 - and use list view to see what in .gnome2 is using that space
details view - i meant
inside .gnome2 ... look there for big files /home/zortec/.gnome2/ here
.gnome2 doesn't have any big files
.gnome2 is the one with 10gigs right?
.gnome2 is only 63.7KB
ok, earlier you said gnome was taking up 10gigs

geirha, Kalmi_: So it's the trash then.  But it's going to take 10GB for the WoW files... so should I consider a bigger partition if I'm going to test gaming on linux? I did 3GB for swap, 10GB for /, and 20GB for home
personally I don't use a home partition - just a 40 gig / and a 300gig stores-which is where I keep all radio station data -- and 8gig swap
I have no intention of upgrading... I use LTS and this server will stay  locked in this mode for the life of the radio station
you will need to do it from the live cd
